alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 11:27AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...AN AREA OF SNOW SHOWERS AND BLOWING SNOW WILL AFFECT EAST CENTRAL CARBON AND CENTRAL ALBANY COUNTIES... At 1125 AM MST...An area of snow showers and blowing snow was affecting portions of eastern Carbon and Albany Counties. Periods of snow showers will persist through 1215 PM MST. HAZARD...Sudden bursts of moderate snow and blowing snow, with visibility under one-quarter mile. Wind gusts to 55 MPH are possible. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous, life threatening travel conditions. Locations impacted include... Elk Mountain and Arlington. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas!

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range
